result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zacorian Jarkell Turner

records.addlTxt: Case was adjourned to Br 2 at the last hearing. Case set to follow defendant's pending matter in Br 2. Parties aware of new date and time.

Defendant Zacorian J Turner in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Zacorian J Turner.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant has possible new pending charges. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Zacorian Jarkell Turner not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Zacorian Jarkell Turner not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means. Attorney Guimont informs the Court that defendant has a pending case in Branch 2. Court allows for global transfer to Branch 2. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services SUPERVISION Report, received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report, received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
Not to be in any stolen vehicle.

Defendant Zacorian Jarkell Turner in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Zacorian Jarkell Turner in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Zacorian Jarkell Turner not in court.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/21/22 @ 1:30p
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
